displaytitle: Caricature of a Man Holding a Tricorn Hat, Facing Left
medium: Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash on cream laid paper
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895

titles.title: Caricature of a Man Holding a Tricorn Hat, Facing Left

makers.displaydate: 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain
makers.displaymaker: Giovanni Battista Tiepolo, 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain

texts.textentryhtml:
Gustav Nebehay, Vienna; purchased by Dan Fellows Platt, stamp (L. 750a), verso, on mount, lower left, in blue.;

Handwritten note: "Purchased from Nebehay, 1931.";

Many of Tiepolo’s caricature figures have proportions gently distorted in a mode of wry humor. The artist’s sweeping pen lines define features and contours in swift strokes, with the diluted wash used economically to capture effects of light and of volume. In this example a pentimento (or change) shows that Tiepolo first conceived of the figure as stepping forward with his right foot, but the revised action suggests that the gentleman may be about to bow, having removed his tricorn hat in greeting.

bibliography.boilertext: George Knox, "Drawings by Giambattista and Domenico Tiepolo at Princeton", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 23, no. 1 (1964): p. 2-28.
